body_html:
The shape of a tensor is itself a 1-D tensor. For example, the shape of a 4-D tensor is a 1-D tensor with 4 elements. This code may make the situation clearer:

>>> np.array(np.zeros((2,3,4,5)).shape).shape
(4,)
body_text:
The shape of a tensor is itself a 1-D tensor.  For example, the shape of a 4-D tensor is a 1-D tensor with 4 elements.  This code may make the situation clearer:
>>> np.array(np.zeros((2,3,4,5)).shape).shape
(4,)
body:
The *shape* of a tensor is itself a 1-D tensor.  For example, the shape of a 4-D tensor is a 1-D tensor with 4 elements.  This code may make the situation clearer:

    >>> np.array(np.zeros((2,3,4,5)).shape).shape
    (4,)
